thread.title: Millburn High School football team falls to Orange High School
thread.title_full: Millburn High School football team falls to Orange High School

title: Millburn High School football team falls to Orange High School
text:
Millburn High School football team falls to Orange High School October 21, 2015 Last updated: Wednesday, October 21, 2015, 3:39 PM By Jim Connelly Print 
They were in position to record a stunning upset victory. 
It was not to be as a late fourth-quarter fumble deep in the opponent's territory denied the Millburn High School varsity football team of an opportunity to snap a 14-14 tie and knock off unbeaten Orange High School Oct. 16 in a Super Essex Conference, Colonial Division contest in Orange. 
Orange (6-0, 2-0 Colonial Division) parlayed a lost fumble by Miller senior running back Wes Moshier at the home team's 26-yard line into a game-winning drive. 
Junior Tyrese Harris scored the go-ahead touchdown on a 30-yard run with a minute remaining. The extra point try failed, accounting for the 20-14 final score. 
A second consecutive loss dropped Millburn to 3-2, 0-2 in the Colonial Division. 
Orange fullback Dadmuel Firmin scored the game's first touchdown on a one-yard run in the opening quarter. The extra point attempt by sophomore Louis Thompson was good. 
Millburn tied the score in the second quarter on an 8-yard run by Moshier and junior Jack Kirshenbaum's extra point. 
A 40-yard scamper by Harris and Thompson's extra point gave the Tornadoes a 14-7 halftime lead. 
Miller senior running back Zack Weinstein (23 carries for 110 yards) scored from four yards out in the third quarter. Kirshenbaum's extra point forged the contest's third tie. 
The Millers also squandered a golden scoring opportunity following a 75-yard kickoff return to the Orange 10 by senior Nick Minter. 
Milburn came away with no points after Kirshenbaum missed a 23-yard field goal. 
MILLER NOTES 
The team's three-game stretch against the top teams in the Colonial Division comes to a close Friday, Oct. 23, when Verona High School (6-0, 2-0) pays a visit to Millburn High School's Dr. Keith A. Neigel Field. 
Senior Night ceremonies are scheduled to begin 30 minutes prior to the 7 p.m. kickoff. 
Verona, which shares first place in the Colonial Division with Orange and Cedar Grove (5-1 overall), carries a state-best 17-game winning streak into the contest. 
The Hillbillies, the reigning New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association North Jersey, Section 1, Group 1 champions, are coming off a 42-16 defeat of Malcolm X Shabazz High School Oct. 16 in Newark. 
Millburn, Shabazz (1-4 overall) and Newark West Side High School (0-6 overall) all stand at 0-2 in the division. 
Games against West Side (Saturday, Oct. 31, at 4 p.m. at Untermann Field in Newark) and Shabazz (Friday, Nov. 6, at 7 p.m. at Shabazz Stadium in Newark) close out Millburn's division schedule. 
Email: connellyj@northjersey.com
